channel.title: Projects on Logan Shiller
channel.description: Recent content in Projects on Logan Shiller

item.title: Welcome
item.description: About me I am a soon to be graduate of UT. Clearly, I am very excited about the whole thing.I thought it would be fun to share a recipe that I recently tried. My all time favorite food is probably mac and cheese. Using r I have calcualted the metric measurements for ingredients and using python I have shown how the two can "talk" to eachother! Ingredients Unexpected cheddar(1/4 of the block, grated) - Trader Joes 6 oz mexican blend shredded cheese 1/8 c flour 1/8 c butter 2 c milk 1/4 tsp each salt,pepper,red pepper flakes, paprika 1/2 tbsp minced garlic 4 oz diced onion or shallot half a box (8 oz) of your favorite noodle.

item.title: Project 1
item.description: In this analysis, data from World Health was used to compare the BMI of men and women, the Blood Pressure of men and women, the calories consumed in a day, and the percentage of a country's budget allocated to healthcare. These datasets share the categorical variable "countries" and "year". This data is interesting because I think that it can paint an interesting picture about overall health in different countries around the world.

item.title: Project 2
item.description: For this project I used most of the same data from the previous project which was created by World Health. I have data that describes all of the countries in the world. The variables are BMI and Blood Pressure for men and women, whether or not the country of question has a universal health care system, and average number of calories eaten per capita/day. There are data ranging from 1980-2008 and I have made subsets of these countries by continent for easier viewing because often having over 200 different variables leads to incoherent statistics.
